description: ASAM OpenMATERIAL 3D Material BRDF look-up table file definition.

metadata.description: The key meta information about the BRDF look-up table.

name.description: The display name of the material, such as 'Red brick' or 'Dark asphalt'.

description.description: Short description of the material in 2 - 3 sentences.

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier for the material in 8-4-4-4-12 format, see cite:[uui]. The uuid stays the same, even if version is updated.

materialVersion.description: The version number of the material, following semantic versioning (for example, '1.0.0').

openMaterialVersion.description: The version of the ASAM OpenMATERIAL 3D specification used, adhering to semantic versioning (for example, '1.0.0').

copyrights.description: Indicates copyright details, including the year and copyright holder (for example, '© 2024 ACME Inc.').

license.description: Describes the license for material distribution. Use an SPDX identifier for open-source licenses (for example, 'MIT'), or provide a URL or filename for proprietary licenses.

authors.description: Lists the author(s) of the material as a name, email, or company.

creationDate.description: The date and time of material creation, formatted as YYYYMMDDTHHMMSSZ according to ISO 8601 cite:[iso8601] (for example, '20240703T101728Z').

sources.description: Source of the BRDF data. Was it measured, simulated, or taken from literature? Multiple sources should be comma-separated.

typicalSensorTechnology.description: Typical sensor technology this BRDF table is used for. Examples: 'radar', 'lidar', 'camera'. If more than one applies, use comma-separation.

brdf.description: The BRDF is used as a basic quantity to characterize the reflecting properties of a surface geometrically. The following BRDF definition applies: “The ratio of the radiance or power per unit solid-angle in the outgoing direction from a unit projected surface area to the collimated irradiance or power per unit projected surface area.” A physically plausible BRDF shall additionally obey the following three properties. (1) Positivity: The BRDF has units of inverse steradians (1/sr) and can vary from 0 to infinity. (2) Helmholtz reciprocity: It is symmetric in the incoming and outgoing direction. (3) Energy conservation: No more radiant energy is reflected from a point on the surface than incident radiant energy to that point.

wavelengths.description: List of all wavelengths in meters contained in the lookup table.

lookupTable.description: Array of bidirectional reflectance distribution function (BRDF) values. The array shall be sorted based on the columns starting with the first.

items.description: Wavelength of radiation in free-space in meters (m).
Incident elevation angle (= zenith angle) relative to the surface normal in rad.
Exit elevation angle (= zenith angle) relative to the surface normal in rad.
Exit azimuth angle in rad. For BRDFs with incident and exit vectors on the same plane as the normal, exit azimuth angle is 0.
